alert.note: Alert for Erie; Genesee; Niagara; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 3:40PM EST until February 19 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Heavy rain and snowmelt on Thursday will continue to produce a flood threat through the weekend. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Batavia. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood stage, some flooding in Batavia, possibly impacting Kibbe Park, Walnut Street, and Law Street. Flooding in rural areas of Alexander and the lowlands of the Alabama Swamps with some road closures likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 11/25/2014. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM EST.
